sections.title: Me
sections.body:
I am intrigued in all things technology, and have been ever since I was 12. I am always excited to learn new and upcoming fields of development, including machine learning, single page web apps/JavaScript everywhere, and anything else I can get my hands on. Apart from software I also enjoy music (I play the guitar and the piano, sing, and have a drum kit to bash occasionally), painting, and am learning die deutsche Sprache.

I am looking for a job that encourages me to try new things and collaborate with other enthusiastic people. I can bring bright eyes and a bushy tail to the workplace (as long as that workplace has coffee).

sections.title: Experience
sections.body: Software Summer Research, Auckland MRI Research Group, November 2017 – February 2018: Under supervision by a Professor and Research Fellow I worked on refactoring and expanding a neural network used to detect and identify parts of the heart. I gained technical experience in Machine Learning and Python, and non-technical experience working in a professional environment, teamwork, and multi-tasking. Professional Casual Staff, Auckland MRI Research Group, March 2018 – Present: Working in the Auckland MRI Research Group on improving the above work project, as well as forming 3d models of the heart from neural networks. References available on request.
